content.title: DeBakey Classification
content.definition: DeBakey Type I: ascending to descending; Type II: ascending only; Type IIIa: descending above diaphragm; Type IIIb: below.
content.statement: DeBakey Classification is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Aortic-Dissection that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding DeBakey Classification helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of DeBakey Classification include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of DeBakey Classification.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
